title: Dangerous structures at Ratmalana Airport to be removed following Jeju Air tragedy
byline: In response to concerns over the risks posed by fixed structures at the Colombo International Airport, Ratmalana and the recent Jeju Air Flight 2216 tragedy at Muan International Airport, South Korea, which claimed 179 lives, Minister Bimal Ratnayake has directed authorities to remove such structures.

title: Government aims to attract high-end tourists: Vijitha Herath
byline: The government is aiming to increase the quality in the tourism sector just as quantity in order to attract high-end tourists to the country, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath said.

title: Suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited further extended
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has announced the extension of the suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) from engaging in the business and activities of a Primary Dealer for an additional six months.

title: Heaviest snowfall in a decade’ threatens parts of the US
byline: Large swaths of the United States, from Kansas to New Jersey, were hit by a massive winter storm that brought snow, ice, wind and Arctic-like temperatures.

title: SriLankan Airlines authorities asked to submit plan for development
byline: The new government which abandoned the previous government’s plan on SriLankan Airlines has now asked its authorities to submit proposals for the development of the national carrier in five years, an informed source said.

title: Police seek help to locate missing 16-year-old girl
byline: The Atampitiya Police are still continuing their investigation to locate a 16-year-old girl who has been missing since November of last year, police said.

title: New Chairman appointed to 1990 Suwa Seriya Foundation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a new Chairman and Board of Members to the 1990 Suwa Seriya Foundation, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Canada PM Trudeau is likely to announce resignation, source says
byline: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is increasingly likely to announce he intends to step down, though he has not made a final decision, a source familiar with Trudeau’s thinking said on Sunday.

title: Parliament tea party expenses higher due to increased costs: Parliament clarifies
byline: The expenses for the tea party hosted during the inauguration of the 10th Parliament was higher as the cost of the goods and services had gone up in the market, Parliament said while clarifying reports on expenses for the tea party hosted during the inauguration.

title: India pledges unconditional support for Sri Lanka’s sports development
byline: India has pledged to provide unconditional support for the development of sports in Sri Lanka, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports said.

title: Salochana Gamage, another further remanded till January 17
byline: Two suspects, including former Provincial Councillor Salochana Gamage, who were arrested for allegedly accepting a bribe, were further remanded till January 17 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Sri Lanka Navy seizes over Rs. 28 Bn worth of drugs and contraband in 2024
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has reported significant achievements in its 2024 operations, seizing over 622kg of heroin, valued at Rs. 15.55 billion and more than 1,211kg of Crystal Methamphetamine (ICE), worth Rs. 11.5 billion.

title: India reports first suspected HMPV case
byline: An eight-month-old baby in Bengaluru is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), marking the first suspected case in India.

title: Government must work on new Constitution without delay: Cardinal
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith specifically urged the government to introduce a new Constitution which brings in national unity.

title: Rice shortage creeps into schools
byline: The students of the Debarara Junior School in Wellawaya Education Zone had been served wheat flour roti and dates for their midday meal instead of rice and curry.

title: Saman Devalaya on strike over political appointment
byline: The administrative body and Kapu Mahaththaya of the Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya stepped down from the daily services (Thewawa) and other duties yesterday (5th) in protest against the appointment of an acting Basnayake Nilame, which they claim violates the temple’s traditions.

title: ’Lankadeepa’ shines at People’s Pinnacle Awards 2024
byline: Our sister paper ‘Lankadeepa’ has won seven awards at the People’s Pinnacle Awards 2024 ceremony, which took place this evening at the Taj Samudra Hotel in Colombo.

title: Kandy demonstrates ‘big team mentality’
byline: Kandy Sports Club pulled off one of the finest comebacks of the season so far when they came from behind to beat Havelock Sports Club in the dying moments of their inter club league rugby clash over the weekend.

title: Govt should focus on effective programmes over ’Clean Sri Lanka’ efforts
byline: It is preferable for the government to implement a more effective programme instead of merely targeting the cleaning of three-wheeler parks, buses and businesses, under the guise of the ’Clean Sri Lanka’ programme, Sri Lanka Podujana Permuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: India pledges unconditional support for Sri Lanka’s sports development
byline: India has pledged to provide unconditional support for the development of sports in Sri Lanka, the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports said.

title: Queues back, people jostle for rice purchases
byline: The step taken by the Ambalantota Trader Association in the Hambantota District to distribute red rice at the control price of Rs.220 a kilo triggered a long queue and a huge rush in the town.

title: ’Magen Ratata’ organization chairman calls for probe into Rs. 260 million pilot boat misuse
byline: Sanjaya Mahawatte, Chairman of the ’Magen Ratata’ organization, lodged a complaint today (6) with the Bribery or Corruption Investigation Commission, calling for a fair investigation into a significant financial loss involving a modern, high-tech pilot boat worth approximately Rs. 260 million.
